sentences.english: The sound of rain gradually faded away, and a piece of slight light indistinctly came though the curtain.
sentences.chinese: 雨聲漸漸的住了，窗簾後隱隱的透進清光來。

sentences.english: He felt a dull throbbing pain in his head.
sentences.chinese: 他感到腦袋隱隱地抽痛。

sentences.english: Suddenly, something loomed up beside her. It was the child.
sentences.chinese: 突然，她隱隱感覺旁邊有人，是那個小孩。

sentences.english: Her eyes ached because she didn't sleep well last night.
sentences.chinese: 由於昨夜沒睡好，她的眼睛隱隱作痛。

sentences.english: That piece of metal in her back hurts almost all the time.
sentences.chinese: 後背裏的那條金屬棒一直讓她隱隱作痛。

sentences.english: Some parleying was audible in the hall, and soon the new-comer entered.
sentences.chinese: 大廳裏隱隱約約響起了交談聲，來人很快便進了屋。

sentences.english: The Wild Goose Pagoda was dimly visible.
I began to dull pain of the wound, but I endured.
sentences.chinese: 時，我的傷口就開始隱隱作痛，但我還是忍着。

sentences.english: My heart seemed to faint in sunlight penetration into the Jisi.
sentences.chinese: 我的心裏似乎隱隱的透進了幾絲陽光。

sentences.english: My feet still ached from the morning orientation and the tour of the school.
sentences.chinese: 經過早上的迎新會和校園參觀，腳也開始隱隱作痛。

sentences.english: The still air smelt faintly of furniture polish.
sentences.chinese: 凝滯的空氣中隱隱有股傢俱上光劑的味道。

sentences.english: However that white clothe up still can see have blood dye unclearly.
sentences.chinese: 不過那白衣上還隱隱能看到有血跡。

sentences.english: The man who brings up a words brain in times before, take illegible of the sincerity hope persist to ask a way.
sentences.chinese: 先前提起話頭的男子，帶着隱隱的真誠祝福繼續問道。

sentences.english: It seems vaguely there was a red mark in Lily's neck.
sentences.chinese: 好像莉莉的脖頸間隱隱地真有一條紅色的印跡。

sentences.english: Mind a calm lake, the faint wish to move with the waves.
sentences.chinese: 心裏一潭平靜中，隱隱有着欲動的波瀾。

sentences.english: Or a gentle touch, will dull pain.
sentences.chinese: 或者輕輕的一碰，就會隱隱作痛。

definition: to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
to flit across/to sweep past/to glance (strike at an angle)
a burst/a fit/a peal/a spell (period of time)
